page.title: 16Public Services in Beckermet
page.content: There is an infrequent public transport service through the village provided by Cumberland Motor Services. The number of buses routed through the village has diminished in the last few years as a result of a decreasing number of passengers related to rising fares. The Railway Station in the village closed in 1964 but there is a request stop station at Braystones which is on the Carlisle to Barrow line. The County Council provide a Refuse Collection Service to the area once a week and also a Road Cleaner. The local policeman lives 3 miles from Beckermet but he is a frequent and respected visitor to the area. Crime is generally in the form of burglaries or motoring offences.Drug related offences are increasing. He drives a Panda car. He teaches the children Cycling.
